description.title: Hardhat: deploy an upgradable contract through a UUPS proxy
description.purpose:
UUPS proxies (universal upgradable proxy standard) were added to supercede transparent proxies as they are more lightweight (cheaper to deploy) and versatile. In UUPS proxies the upgrade is handled by the implementation, though they use the same interface for upgrading. Upgrades are triggered by via the logic contrac, which therefore must extend the UUPSUpgradeable interface, and uses a unique storage slot in the proxy contract to store the address of the logic contract. Upgradability can be removed in this model which makes them more versatile.
In the test a single hardhat script is used to deploy and then upgrade a simple contract that returns a hardcoded value for it's version. The test simply performs the deployment and upgrade, and then queries for the version to ensure the upgrade was successfull. The interface of the contract is not changed.
Skipped due to https://github.com/ten-protocol/ten-internal/issues/3878
